comment.author: 23682239@N07
comment._content: No FX/FJ Holdens visible, and ladies fashions seem post-war, so I think 1946-7 is most likely.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Just searching the digitised newspapers for 'Newlands House' (at 141-143 Elizabeth Street) it disappears off the radar after 1954...but this is almost certainly due to the fact that the SMH hasn't been digitised beyond 1954...Just going on the more relaxed look of the people in the park, my hunch is that it's the 1950s rather than the 1940s...but then the absence of FX's (produced 1948-1953) is a good point...and probably a telling one...so maybe 1940s is it! Can anyone read the headlines on the newspaper which the bloke in the black suit is carrying? Here's a good pic of this stretch of Elizabeth St from the SL NSW collection which is dated 1926-1933 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=41837 Here's an arguably better one by Sam Hood - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=7575 Here's Bert Salmon's pic of the Archibald Fountain taken in ca. 1932 which just misses out including Newlands House - www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02/6399415641/in/set-7215... Not sure whether this 1952 pic is helpful - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=139965 Here's a 1954 pic - www.photosau.com.au/cos/scripts/ExtSearch.asp?SearchTerm=... Here's a 1949 pic - www.photosau.com.au/cos/scripts/ExtSearch.asp?SearchTerm=... Hey! I've just discovered that the experts have been over this ground a while ago! - www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/6154754109/ The woman/girl lying down on the grass looks to be wearing something like a pair of Joyce shoes (made in California) with their distinctive wedge sole. I gather Joyce were a popular brand in Australia in the late 1940s and early 1950s. Check this advert from 1948 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article18074689 Ha! Now I see the date has been established over at the Archives Outside blog via a pic at the SLNSW collection which was taken ?maybe about 30 seconds before this one! Amazing! The date is 1947 evidently.
